image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: The $368 billion AUKUS pact is promising to return submarine construction to Australia. But residents have just learned the deal also means nuclear waste will be stored on their doorstep.

title.children: 'Sly and conniving': Government plan to store AUKUS nuclear waste in suburbs blindsides residents

image.altText: Montrezl Harrell of the Adelaide 36ers fights with Melbourne United players

props.synopsis: The NBL is investigating a confrontation between players and fans during Sunday's game between Melbourne United and the Adelaide 36ers, as Nick Kyrgios throws his hat into the ring, backing 36er Montrezl Harrell.

title.children: NBL investigates after Melbourne United and Adelaide 36ers melee spills over sidelines and leads to fan evictions

image.altText: A smiling man in police uniform leans against a police car outside a police station

props.synopsis: A year on, the town of Lucindale is still grieving the death of their local cop, volunteer and friend. Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig was fatally shot while attending a rural property in South Australia 12 months ago.

title.children: 'The community was his family': Cricket match held to remember cop who died in the line of duty

image.altText: A young teenage footballer holding the ball on field

props.synopsis: Angus Clarke spent this past winter making an eight-hour round trip twice a week to play his beloved footy. He's one of many regional young footballers sacrificing time and money to get noticed and will soon find out whether his efforts will be rewarded with an AFL draft pick.

title.children: For teenage AFL draft prospects, the big league is often the reward for going the extra mile

image.altText: a young boy standing on a golf course with a bag of golf clubs and a putting flag over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Young people across the country are increasingly taking up golf with the intent to pursue it into the future — a phenomenon a PGA professional in South Australia did not see coming.

title.children: Young golfers tee up to grow the sport that's not just for retirees

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas on the hustings on polling day during the Black by-election.

props.synopsis: Labor has described the Black by-election boilover as a "vote of confidence" — but the result is equally, if not more, telling for the South Australian Liberal Party, which has been whittled down to just 13 lower house MPs.

title.children: After the Black by-election, Peter Malinauskas's grip on power is becoming a stranglehold

image.altText: A close up shot of an elephant.

props.synopsis: The end of an era is fast approaching Perth Zoo's Asian elephants Putra Mas and Permai prepare to move to their forever home, thousands of kilometres away.

title.children: Gentle giants to leave Perth Zoo more than two years after Tricia the elephant's death

image.altText: Matilda Scholz celebrates after Port Adelaide's semifinal victory over Hawthorn 2024

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide going from 15th to a preliminary is more than just a feel good story. It's shows the growing competitive range of AFLW.

title.children: Port Adelaide's AFLW rise is a story of grit and determination but also one of hope

image.altText: Jaxon Evans's car crashes into the wall

props.synopsis: Sunday's qualifying session at the Adelaide 500 had just seconds remaining when Jaxon Evans lost control of his Chevrolet Camaro on the same corner where three other drivers crashed just days earlier.

title.children: Supercars legend calls for Adelaide track change after high-speed crash on infamous corner leaves driver concussed

image.altText: A beekeeper inspecting a frame of bees from a beehive.

props.synopsis: As the varroa mite continues to cut a destructive path across Australia, demand and prices for pollination services are set to rise — and some producers say shoppers could feel the sting at the check-out.

title.children: While beekeepers face the biggest challenge in the industry's history, will food prices be affected?

image.altText: Caroline Kennedy press club

props.synopsis: The outgoing diplomat also called her cousin Robert F Kennedy Jr's vaccine views "dangerous" in a wide-ranging Press Club appearance.

title.children: Caroline Kennedy urges calm on Trump in farewell address as US ambassador to Australia

image.altText: Matt Canavan and Ralph Babet thumbs up

props.synopsis: Indigenous senator Lidia Thorpe has been censured over her confrontation of King Charles, and Clive Palmer-backed senator Ralph Babet is censured over offensive comments he made online following the election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Senate censures Lidia Thorpe over King Charles protest and Ralph Babet over offensive tweets after Trump win

image.altText: A drone image of Chevron's Gorgon project on Barrow Island.

props.synopsis: Amid the spinifex on a remote Western Australian island looms Chevron's troubled carbon capture facility. The role the technology might play in cutting greenhouse gas emissions is likely to get a fresh airing at global climate talks in Azerbaijan.

title.children: The carbon capture facility at Chevron's WA project tells a cautionary tale

image.altText: shows green Woolworths illuminated  sign at the entrance to the store

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has bounced back after an early stumble, while NAB is being sued by ASIC and the ACCC grills Woolworths' bosses. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX bounces back, ACCC grills Woolworths and ASIC sues NAB

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 up 0.1pc as miners bounce back; banks and CSL fall

image.altText: A wooden boat on the open water

props.synopsis: From the film business to trading salt and gypsum, the paddle vessel Amphibious has gone through multiple makeovers in its nearly 150 years on the water. Its new owners want to make sure the second-oldest wooden vessel is there for generations to come.

title.children: Family takes on Australia's second-oldest wooden boat despite its unlucky history

image.altText: A woman wearing a kangaroo cloak speaks while smoke comes from a fire pit with other people watching

props.synopsis: A monument to the 26 deaths of shipwreck survivors in 1840 is being put into context thanks to a collaboration that those involved hope will be replicated around the country.

title.children: 'Whole story' of how colonialism led to shipwreck massacre told anew in SA town

image.altText: An image taken from the exterior of a group of staff sitting around a board table .

props.synopsis: Despite flexible work being a popular choice for employees, a recent survey of CEOs shows 83 per cent want their workforce back in the office full time within three years.

title.children: CEOs want workers back in the office. How much longer will working from home be realistic?

image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: The $368 billion AUKUS pact is promising to return submarine construction to Australia. But residents have just learned the deal also means nuclear waste will be stored on their doorstep.

title.children: 'It's madness': Residents just learned nuclear waste from AUKUS subs would be stored locally

image.altText: A man in a grey black suit and glasses smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: In a bid to free three of its executives who have been detained in Mali over a tax dispute, Resolute Mining agrees to pay $US160 million ($242 million) to the African country's government.

title.children: Australian miner agrees to pay $US160 million after executives detained in Africa

image.altText: An Indigenous woman and a toddler look at the camera for a photo.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother and Indigenous community leader tells a Japanese court she was "deceived" after she was found with almost 2 kilograms of methamphetamine in her luggage at Narita airport, near Tokyo.

title.children: 'I am innocent': Perth grandmother fights back tears as drug smuggling trial begins in Japan

image.altText: A small boy with his left arm in a bandage is treated by a medical worker in a head scarf.

props.synopsis: The Kamal Adwan hospital is struggling to remain operating after a major attack by the IDF, which claimed Hamas militants were sheltering in the facility.

title.children: Inside the northern Gaza hospital besieged by Israeli forces

image.altText: People with brooms and boots clean muddy road with broom

props.synopsis: Australia is being urged to heed the lessons of Spain's devastating floods and make sure that warning systems and emergency response capabilities are up to tackling disasters that are becoming more frequent and more intense.

title.children: 'Disasters are getting much worse': Australia can learn from Spain's recent deadly floods

image.altText: A man with slicked-back hair wearing a dark blue suit

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White takes to the stand in his own manslaughter trial, marking the first time he has spoken publicly since tasering great-grandmother Clare Nowland.

title.children: 'Devastated' police officer who tasered 95yo tells court 'you don't underestimate anyone carrying a knife'

image.altText: A tilapia fish.

props.synopsis: Tilapia is a biosecurity nightmare in Australia but popular on many menus overseas. Some in the fishing industry think if you catch the pest fish in Queensland you should be able to eat it.

title.children: Considered delicious fare overseas, if you catch this pest fish in Queensland you can't eat it

image.altText: NAB bank signage in red, black and white colours

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator alleges NAB did not respond to 345 hardship applications within the legal time frame. NAB has apologised and says it's changed its approach.

title.children: NAB sued by ASIC for failures in financial hardship claims

image.altText: Cbus super logo

props.synopsis: ASIC's decision to sue Cbus, alleging systemic claims-handling failures, after lengthy delays in death and disability claims, could be a watershed moment to revisit a sector that sits in a privileged position of looking after Australians' retirement savings with little scrutiny.

title.children: Cbus super fund investigation shines a light on red flags in the $4 trillion super industry

image.altText: Sydney web developer Indra Arifin stands at a light rail stop in sydney wearing glasses and looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A QR code poster on the inside of a tram door is the only indication that commuters are opting-in to a data collection trial via their mobile phones. It's stopped one passenger from catching the light rail entirely.

title.children: Commuters are handing over their data to Sydney light rail services as soon as they step on the tram

image.altText: A young woman sits on a vespa on the street, smiling, while nuns in white walk by

props.synopsis: From Vespas to lamps, the bright, bold, post-war designs coming out of Italy quickly spread around the world, bringing a futuristic feel to our homes.

title.children: From furniture for fascist headquarters to a feminist chair: How Italian design has influenced the world

image.altText: A pile of Australian money, in both coins and notes.

props.synopsis: The federal government will require businesses to accept cash as payment for groceries, fuel and other essentials, but will phase out cheques entirely within five years.

title.children: Federal government to require businesses to accept cash for fuel, groceries

image.altText: mid shot of man wearing glasses and suit with plane in background

props.synopsis: Both parties are in pre-election mode: clearing barnacles and ridding themselves of potential baggage that could weigh down their campaigns.

title.children: Killing season is here, but the leaders have something else on their minds

image.altText: A street litted with storm debris including a tin roof.

props.synopsis: Three commercial buildings in the same tiny town were destroyed after wild storms smashed much of NSW yesterday. A major clean-up is underway and more storms are forecast for the state's north today.

title.children: Town where Bowie filmed Let's Dance loses pub, pizza shop and general store in wild storm

image.altText: A bush fire.

props.synopsis: Fire investigators are treating a bushfire which destroyed at least one home in Victoria's west as suspicious. There are fears the fire could burn for weeks.

title.children: Fire authorities suspect bushfire in Victoria's west was deliberately lit, blaze could burn for weeks

image.altText: Levi Ashcroft poses for a photo with a medal around his enck after a game

props.synopsis: With this year's AFL draft just days away, we've answered all the biggest questions from live draft night trading to the controversial points system used for matching bids.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the AFL draft from live trading to the bidding process as the next generation arrives

image.altText: A man in a fawn-coloured coat smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government receives justice Gregory Geason's resignation, a day before parliament was to ask the governor to sack him.

title.children: Supreme Court Justice Gregory Geason follows through with resignation after assault conviction

props.synopsis: The National Archives of Australia has digitised over a million service records from World War II, many of which haven't been seen for 80 years.

title.children: Merle was one of many who served in WWII. Aged 104, she's seeing her records for the first time
